Column Comment.0: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.1: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.2: WELL TEST TYPE: This reference table identifies the general type of test used toevaluate the potential of the well. For example, Drill Stem Tests (DST), RepeatFormation Tests (RFT), Initial Potential(IP).
Column Comment.3: RUN NUMBER: A number which uniquely identifies the run or trip into the well for thepurpose of operating a test.
Column Comment.4: TEST_NUMBER: A number used to uniquely identify the individual test occurringwithin a test run or trip.
Column Comment.5: MEASUREMENT OBSERVATION NUMBER: Observation number defining theuniqueness of each time increment.
Column Comment.6: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.7: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.8: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.9: MEASUREMENT PRESSURE: Increment pressure is taken at a specified time in theperiod.
Column Comment.10: MEASUREMENT PRESSURE OUOM: Increment pressure original unit of measure.
Column Comment.11: MEASUREMENT TEMPERATURE: Increment temperature is taken at a specifiedtime in the period.
Column Comment.12: MEASUREMENT TEMPERATURE OUOM: Increment temperature original unit ofmeasure.
Column Comment.13: MEASUREMENT TIME ELAPSED: Increment time is taken in reference to the startof the period.
Column Comment.14: MEASUREMENT TIME ELAPSED OUOM: Well test increment time original unit ofmeasure.
Column Comment.15: PERIOD OBSERVATION NUMBER: Unique observation number assigned to eachperiod.
Column Comment.16: TEST PERIOD TYPE: This reference table describes a well test time pressure periodtype. For example hydrostatic, shutin, valve open or flowing.
Column Comment.17: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should becreated.
Column Comment.18: RECORDER IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier assigned to each recorder.
Column Comment.19: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.20: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.21: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.22: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.23: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.24: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.25: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.26: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
